metadata.title: Dialog on difficulties with the knee
speaker: Rogelia

phrases.translation: How long has your knee been hurting you?
It's been a couple of weeks.
Have you ever injured your knee?

phrases.transcription: U̠'un.  Köñú'u ini-i tú ni̠ta̠xin kondo-i.

phrases.translation: Does your work require you to do a lot of kneeling?
Does your knee ever give way or buckle when you walk?

phrases.transcription: Á ndíta ndútuun ko̠ndo̠-un, kökuvi ndundǎku-ña?
phrases.translation: Does your knee sometimes lock so that you cannot completely straighten your leg?
Does your knee feel stiff when you get up in the morning?
Yes, it's worse in the morning.

phrases.transcription: Koto ndosó-yu ko̠ndo̠-un tá índichi-un, tá índu'ú-un, tá kándú'u-un.
phrases.translation: I'm going to examine your knee while you are standing, sitting, and lying down.
